jibe.sdk.client.simple.videosharing
Class OneWayVideoSharingConnection

java.lang.Object
  jibe.sdk.client.simple.videosharing.OneWayVideoSharingConnection
All Implemented Interfaces:
SimpleApi, SimpleConnection
public class OneWayVideoSharingConnection
extends java.lang.Object
implements SimpleConnection

High-level API class, offering convenient set-up of app-to-app live video sharing/streaming (one-way). See jibe.sdk.client.simple for code examples.

Constructor Detail

OneWayVideoSharingConnection

public OneWayVideoSharingConnection(Context context,
                                    SimpleConnectionStateListener listener,
                                    CameraMediaSource cameraMediaSource)
Constructor for SENDER SIDE. This also starts the asynchronous initialization of the OneWayVideoSharingConnection.

Important: the application needs to invoke dispose() before this class goes out of scope.

You will need to declare the following permissions in the manifest in order to use the device camera for video:
<uses-permission android:name="android.permission.CAMERA" />
<uses-feature android:name="android.hardware.camera" />
<uses-feature android:name="android.hardware.camera.autofocus" />

Parameters:
context - Context creating the LiveVideoConnection. Needed for camera access.
listener - A reference to the class that has implemented the SimpleConnectionStateListener, which will handle the callbacks associated with connection state changes.
cameraMediaSource - Local camera (front cam, back cam, etc.) providing the local video input jibe.sdk.client.videosharing.CameraMediaSource

OneWayVideoSharingConnection

public OneWayVideoSharingConnection(Context context,
                                    SimpleConnectionStateListener listener,
                                    SurfaceView remoteVideoView)
Constructor for RECEIVER SIDE. This also starts the asynchronous initialization of the OneWayVideoSharingConnection.

Important: the application needs to invoke dispose() before this class goes out of scope.

Parameters:
context - Context creating the LiveVideoConnection. Needed for auto-acceptance of incoming video.
listener - A reference to the class that has implemented the SimpleConnectionStateListener, which will handle the callbacks associated with connection state changes.
remoteVideoView - Surface where video received from remote part is rendered jibe.sdk.client.videosharing.VideoSurfaceView
Method Detail

start

public void start(java.lang.String remoteUserId)
           throws java.io.IOException,
                  java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                  java.lang.IllegalStateException,
                  JibeServiceException
See SimpleConnection.start(String)

Specified by:
start in interface SimpleConnection
Parameters:
remoteUserId - The phone number/SIP URI of user you are trying to connect (e.g. +491235678 or (408) 345-6789)
Throws:
java.io.IOException - if there is a problem with the network connection
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the remote userId is not a valid phone number of at least 3 digits
java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the SimpleConnection class is not idle any more (e.g. already STARTED or DISPOSED) or not initialized yet
JibeServiceException - if there is a problem communication with the Jibe Realtime Engine (an Android background service)
